.
Who Must Issue the Decision After a Hearing
The hearing official must issue the subsequent decision based on the hearing testimony.
Rationale
:  Presenting testimony in person before the decision maker is key to the due process right to a hearing.  Being able to hear and see the participants during the proceedings gives the hearing official the ability to observe the appearance and demeanor of the witness, which may emphasize or highlight the credibility of that evidence among any conflicting evidence of record.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart v, Chapter 1, Section D  - Regional Office (RO) Hearings
